timeline.message:
Merge pull request #1 from ldtteam/version/1.15

update

replies.bodyText: I changed Chicken Herder to Chicken Farmer, but what about Swine Herder?
replies.author: ravenbuilder934

replies.bodyText: Well, it's close, but I'd change it to Swineherd. The other alternative in the dictionary is swineman, but I much prefer swineherd.
replies.author: Mekle001

timeline.message: Add support for new messages and formats
Mekle made it so the cook can now use items like pots and pans (during crafting). This commit fixes the in-game help to reflect that.

replies.bodyText: gasps in horror (but goes to change it because Shadow is right)
replies.author: ravenbuilder934

timeline.bodyText:
Labelling something "vanilla" breaks immersion a tad. I'm fine with that, but just thought I'd give the feedback.
Also happens way down where the phrase "user interface" is used.
timeline.author: ShadowProtocol

timeline.bodyText:
Ellipses should always have spaces around them unless one end is a punctuation mark.
How about 'You have rallied your army ... of none. Good luck!"

   "com.minecolonies.coremod.info.builder.2.name": "FAQ",
   "com.minecolonies.coremod.info.builder.2": "Now let's cover some frequently asked questions:\n\n Q 1. I'm seeing an item in the required resources page that seems unobtainable or requires Silk Touch to get. What should I do?\n   A 1. Things like Air, Dirt Paths, and other blocks will show up in the required resources tab from time to time. While they do show up, focus mainly on your Builder's personal request tab. They'll usually request the correct block and convert it accordingly (e.g. request Dirt and then use a shovel on it).",
   "com.minecolonies.coremod.info.builder.3.name": "Leveling",
-  "com.minecolonies.coremod.info.builder.3": "As all workers do, the Builder levels up while working.\n With higher levels, the Builder's speed increases. The higher their hut level, the quicker they level up. \n However, their level is capped by the level of their home. Thus, if they are unhappy with their living conditions, they will stop leveling until you provide them with better housing.",
+  "com.minecolonies.coremod.info.builder.3": "As all workers do, the Builder levels up while working.\n At higher levels, the Builder's speed increases. The higher their hut level and Intelligence skill, the quicker they level up. \n However, their level is capped by the level of their home. Thus, if they are unhappy with their living conditions, they will stop leveling unless you provide them with better housing.",

-  "com.minecolonies.coremod.info.citizen.0": "The Citizen Hut is where your citizens will live. For every level of the Citizen Hut the building will house one citizen. You will need multiple houses to house everyone. The only citizens that will not live in a Citizen Hut are your Guards.",
+  "com.minecolonies.coremod.info.citizen.0": "The Citizen Hut is where your citizens will live. For every level of the Citizen Hut, the building will house one citizen. You will need multiple houses to house everyone. The only citizens that will not live in a Citizen Hut are your Guards.",
   "com.minecolonies.coremod.info.citizen.1.name": "Children",
-  "com.minecolonies.coremod.info.citizen.1": "In order to have children, a male and a female citizen must be housed together in one Citizen Hut. Even if you don't have room in the same hut as them, as long as there is an open bed in any hut within the colony, a child can be born. If there is an adult in another house, the child will be adopted by them, taking on the last name of that adult. If there is a hut with no adult in it, the child will get a random name.",
+  "com.minecolonies.coremod.info.citizen.1": "In order to have children, a male and a female citizen must be housed together in one Citizen Hut. Even if you don't have room in the same hut as them, as long as there is an open bed in any Citizen Hut or Tavern within the colony, a child can be born.    "com.minecolonies.coremod.info.miner.2.name": "FAQ",
   "com.minecolonies.coremod.info.miner.2": "Now let's cover some frequently asked questions:

 Q 1. How far down will my miner dig before making nodes?
   A 1. Without intervention, at level 1 they will build nodes after they hit y level 50, at level 2 they will make nodes after they hit y level 30, and at level 3 they will make nodes after they hit y level 5. 

",
   "com.minecolonies.coremod.info.miner.3.name": "FAQ con't",
-  "com.minecolonies.coremod.info.miner.3": "Q2. My miner just stops working or wanders around above ground, why?
  A 2. Either something is blocking their path or they don't have the necessary materials. See page 1 for the materials they need or check the miners request page.",
+  "com.minecolonies.coremod.info.miner.3": "Q2. My Miner just stops working or wanders around above ground, why?
  A 2. Either something is blocking their path or they don't have the necessary materials. See page 1 for the materials they need or check the Miner's request page.",
   "com.minecolonies.coremod.info.miner.4.name": "Leveling",
-  "com.minecolonies.coremod.info.miner.4": "As all workers do, the Miner levels up while working.
 With higher levels, the Miner's speed increases. The higher their hut level, the quicker they level up. 
 However, their level is capped by the level of their home. Thus, if they are unhappy with their living conditions, they will stop leveling until you provide them with better housing.",
+  "com.minecolonies.coremod.info.miner.4": "As all workers do, Miners level up while working.
 At higher levels, the Miner's speed increases. The higher their hut level and Intelligence skill, the quicker they level up. 
 However, their level is capped by the level of their home. Thus, if they are unhappy with their living conditions, they will stop leveling unless you provide them with better housing.",
 
   "com.minecolonies.coremod.info.lumberjack.0.name": "Introduction",
-  "com.minecolonies.coremod.info.lumberjack.0": "The lumberjack is one of the production workers for your colony. Give him an axe and he'll cut down any trees around him, he'll also replant a sapling where the tree was if he has any.
 If you wish to apply restrictions on what trees he can or can't cut, take a look at the second page.
 Even cooler is the third page, here you can tell the lumberjack to not replant saplings, or you can tell him to be restricted to a certain area (selected with the tool given by the third button on the page).",
+  "com.minecolonies.coremod.info.lumberjack.0": "The Lumberjack is one of the production workers for your colony. Give them an axe and they'll cut down any trees around them. They'll also replant a sapling where the tree was if he has any.
 If you wish to apply restrictions on what trees they can or can't cut, take a look at the second page.
 Even cooler is the third page. Here you can tell the Lumberjack to not replant saplings and tell them to be restricted to a certain area (selected with the tool given by the third button on the page).",
   "com.minecolonies.coremod.info.lumberjack.1.name": "Restrictions",
-  "com.minecolonies.coremod.info.lumberjack.1": "Now let's cover restrictions:

 1. Lumberjacks unlock certain tool levels per their hut level:
   lvl 0. Wood/Gold Tools
   lvl 1. Stone Tools
   lvl 2. Iron Tools
   lvl 4. Diamond Tools
   lvl 5. Enchanted Tools

 2. Lumberjacks are able to search for trees within a 150 blocks of their worker (not the hut), while searching they start with a 50 block search range and then increase that range by 5 when they do not find a tree.",
+  "com.minecolonies.coremod.info.lumberjack.1": "Now let's cover restrictions:

 1. Lumberjacks unlock certain tool levels per their hut level:
   lvl 0. Wood/Gold Tools
   lvl 1. Stone Tools
   lvl 2. Iron Tools
   lvl 4. Diamond Tools
   lvl 5. Enchanted Tools

 2. Lumberjacks are able to search for trees within 150 blocks of them (not their hut). While searching, they start with a 50 block range and then increase that range by 5 if they do not find a tree.",
   "com.minecolonies.coremod.info.lumberjack.2.name": "Tree Detection",
-  "com.minecolonies.coremod.info.lumberjack.2": "3. The definition of a "Tree" in Minecraft is pretty hazy at best, we've done our best to define a tree, but in some cases it may not be enough. Generally we define a tree as a log and leaves (within a near vicinity), due to this some of your huts or decorations may be affected by the lumberjack, to counter this you can place a piece of Cobblestone below a log to mark it as "not a tree".",
+  "com.minecolonies.coremod.info.lumberjack.2": "3. The definition of a "Tree" in Minecraft is pretty hazy at best. We've done our best to define a tree, but in some cases it may not be enough. Generally we define a tree as a log and leaves (near each other), due to this some of your huts or decorations may be affected by the lumberjack, to counter this you can place a piece of Cobblestone below a log to mark it as "not a tree".",
   "com.minecolonies.coremod.info.lumberjack.3.name": "Leveling",
-  "com.minecolonies.coremod.info.lumberjack.3": "As all workers the lumberjack levels up while chopping trees.
 Similar to the builder, with higher levels their speed increases. The higher the hut level is the quicker they level up. 
 However, their level is capped by the level of their home. Thus, if they are unhappy with their living conditions they will stop leveling until you provide them with better housing.",
+  "com.minecolonies.coremod.info.lumberjack.3": "As all workers do, Lumberjacks level up while chopping trees.
 At higher levels, the Lumberjack's speed increases. The higher their hut level and Intelligence skill, the quicker they level up. 
 However, their level is capped by the level of their home. Thus, if they are unhappy with their living conditions, they will stop leveling unless you provide them with better housing.",

   "com.minecolonies.coremod.info.warehouse.1.name": "Restrictions",
-  "com.minecolonies.coremod.info.warehouse.1": "Let's cover restrictions:

 1. +  "com.minecolonies.coremod.info.warehouse.1": "Let's cover restrictions:

 1. Space is limited to the number of racks in the schematic and you can not add your own. If you break a rack, it is no longer seen by the Couriers.",

-  "com.minecolonies.coremod.info.warehouse.2": "3. Now let's cover some frequently asked questions:

",

 Q 1. I need more storage space that is given, how do I get more?

",

-  "com.minecolonies.coremod.info.deliveryman.0": "The delivermen are part of colony management. +  "com.minecolonies.coremod.info.deliveryman.0": "Couriers are part of colony management. They are the transportation service of the colony and will pick up unneeded items from worker huts and drop them at the Warehouse, as well as gather needed items from the Warehouse and deliver them to workers.",
   "com.minecolonies.coremod.info.deliveryman.1.name": "Restrictions",
-  "com.minecolonies.coremod.info.deliveryman.1": "Now let's cover restrictions:

 The amount of items the deliveryman can carry depends on his hut level. 
 Level 1: 1 Stack 
 Level 2: 2 Stacks 
 Level 3: 4 Stacks 
 Level 4: 8 Stacks 
 Level 5: unlimited",
+  "com.minecolonies.coremod.info.deliveryman.1": "Now let's cover restrictions:

 The number of stacks a Courier can carry at a time depends on their hut level. 
 Level 1: 1 Stack 
 Level 2: 2 Stacks 
 Level 3: 4 Stacks 
 Level 4: 8 Stacks 
 Level 5: unlimited stacks (that can still fit in their inventory)",
   "com.minecolonies.coremod.info.deliveryman.2.name": "FAQ",
-  "com.minecolonies.coremod.info.deliveryman.2": "Now let's cover some frequently asked questions:

 Q 1. How do I change the priority of who the deliverymen pickup from?
   A 1. In each hut, there is a Pickup priority setting, it can be set to automatic (auto set), manual (you change the setting at the bottom 1 is lowest, 10 is highest, or never (no items will ever be picked up.

 Q 2. Can I can the delivery priority?
 A 2. No, the delivery schedule is determined by order the request is sent. ",
+  "com.minecolonies.coremod.info.deliveryman.2": "Now let's cover some frequently asked questions:

 Q 1. How do I change the priority of who the Couriers pickup from?
   A 1. In each hut, there is a pickup priority setting. 1 is the lowest, 10 is the highest, and there's also never (no items will ever be picked up).

 Q 2. Can I change the delivery priority?
 A 2. No, the delivery schedule is determined by order the request is sent.",
   "com.minecolonies.coremod.info.deliveryman.3.name": "Leveling",
-  "com.minecolonies.coremod.info.deliveryman.3": "As all workers the deliveryman levels up while delivering and picking up items.
 With higher levels the deliverymen's speed increases. The higher the hut level is the quicker they level up. 
 However, their level is capped by the level of their home. Thus, if they are unhappy with their living conditions they will stop leveling until you provide them with better housing.",
+  "com.minecolonies.coremod.info.deliveryman.3": "As all workers do, Couriers level up while delivering and picking up items.
 At higher levels, a Courier's speed increases. The higher their hut level and Intelligence skill, the quicker they level up. 
 However, their level is capped by the level of their home. Thus, if they are unhappy with their living conditions, they will stop leveling unless you provide them with better housing.",

",
